intro: Glycine albidiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered soybean, is a leguminous plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, climbing vines and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped pods containing one to three seeds. Glycine albidiflora is valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a forage crop. It has a shallow root system and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
